column5: Can any of you refer me to a reputible veternarian in the Stoney Creek area?  I have a 9 year old yellow lab retired 2 years ago from from field trials, with a bad limp in her left hind leg that needs to be cared for asap.  Thanks

If you are willing to travel to Caledonia??? you will get better service at Grand River Vets.. Been taking my dogs there for over 15 years.. very caring hospital even call to check on your animals after Surgery... more than my surgeon ever did when I had surgery.. go figure

When I lived at home, we took my sisters cats to the place across from Fiesta Mall, if that place exists. Somewhere right near the Dairy Queen, they did a very good job on the cats for what we were getting done. The recovery time was almost nothing.  I can't say any of the dogs have ever been there though.

I would second Grand River Veterinarian clinic.  I grew up in Mount hope and had dogs all my life (til' marriage).. they are good folks and were always fair and respectful.  Gerritt.  PS... I hope that beauty of a lab makes it out just fine... she is a good looking ol' gal.
I go to Beattie Animal hospital in Brantford. Good service, fair rates and the vets are quite good IMHO

....As a new dog owner in east Hamilton I've had my pup at Kingsway Animal Hospital (1770 King St. East) three times this past month. Service has been top notch though I have nothing else to compare it too. I've heard that they may be a tad pricier than others but it's close to home.
Thanks to everyone for your feedack.  HG
If you don't mind the drive down the road, Lincoln Vets on Bartlett in Beamsville were excellent when I had my Yellow Lab.  Great people.

took my dog back in the day to the one across from fiesta mall... she stuck a thermometer in his butt and asked me if i want him neutered...  that was the last time i ever took him there...  I then started taking him to the one on king st across from the old power house... friendly people good price too
